caption: This video introduces the lives of squid and bees in warm oceans, as well as their survival methods in the desert. Squid use the Agulhas Current to incubate their eggs and can lay up to 100 small squid at a time, helping each other grow through communication. Bees, on the other hand, rely on desert waterways to catch fish. The kingdom's crocodiles return from the sea to provide food for birds.
